Layer.onKeyPress

Function/Meaning
Character input
Type
Event of the Layer class
Syntax
onKeyPress(key, process=true)
Arguments
key The character that was input.
process When calling the parent class's onKeyPress, if false is passed to this argument, the parent class will not perform the default processing for that key (such as moving focus).
Description
Occurs when a character is input. Unlike Layer.onKeyDown, which handles virtual key codes, this event handles the character itself. This event does not occur if the pressed key is not related to a character (such as a function key).
